item.title: China unveils 3-year ‘data action plan’ as Beijing seeks to boost growth through tech
item.description:
Summary：

China's National Data Administration aims to harness the country's vast data resources to drive economic growth. The three-year plan includes building over 300 representative application scenarios, expanding the data industry by 20% annually, and promoting data trading. This initiative seeks to cultivate new economic drivers by leveraging China's market size, data reserves, and use cases. It involves supporting AI development, building high-quality datasets, and addressing challenges like low data quality, poor circulation, and untapped potential. The NDA, established in March 2022, is tasked with coordinating data infrastructure construction and promoting data integration, sharing, and utilization across various sectors.
  • Abstract: China's plan to utilize data for economic growth.
  • Theme: The establishment of the National Data Administration (NDA) and its three-year action plan to transform data into a driving force for China's economy.
  • Viewpoint: The importance of data as a production factor in stimulating economic development.
  • Main information: Building representative application scenarios, expanding the data industry, mobilizing data resources for AI development, addressing challenges in data quality, circulation, and applications, and promoting data utilization in various industries.

总结：

中国的国家数据局旨在利用国家巨大的数据资源来推动经济增长。 这项为期三年的计划包括构建超过 300 个代表性应用场景，在未来三年内每年将数据行业扩展 20%，并促进数据交易。此项计划旨在通过利用中国广阔的市场规模、数据储备和使用案例来培育新的经济驱动力。它涉及支持人工智能发展，构建高质量的数据集，并应对诸如数据质量低下、流通不畅和潜在能力尚未开发等挑战。国家数据局于 2022 年 3 月成立，负责协调数据基础设施建设并促进跨不同行业的数据整合、共享和利用。
  • 摘要：中国利用数据实现经济增长的计划。
  • 主题：国家数据局及其三年行动计划，将数据转变为中国经济的主要驱动力。
  • 观点：数据作为刺激经济发展生产要素的重要性。
  • 主要信息：构建代表性应用场景，扩大数据行业，调集数据资源以发展人工智能，应对数据质量、流通和应用中的挑战，促进数据在各个行业的利用。

单词：

  • unleash (v.) - /ʌnˈliːʃ/ 释放，解开。

    原文例句：The goal was to unleash economic value while ensuring security and privacy.

    例句讲解：这个单词由un-（不）和leash（皮带）组成，表示“释放，解开”。在这个例句中，它表示目标是释放经济价值，同时确保安全和隐私。

  • circulate (v.) - /ˈsɜːkjʊˌleɪt/ 流通，循环。

    原文例句：China’s digital economy, having developed rapidly in recent years, still faces challenges including the low quality of data supply, a poor circulation mechanism and untapped potential for applications, it said.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Latin，由circum-（环绕）和late（携带）组成，表示“流转，循环，传播”。在这个例句中，它表示中国数字经济在近年迅速发展的同时，仍面临着数据供应质量低、流通不畅、应用潜力尚未开发等挑战。

词组：

  • information technology (IT) - 信息技术。

    原文例句：The new administration, which officially began operations in October, is tasked with “coordinating and promoting the construction of data infrastructure, coordinating the integration, sharing, development and utilisation of data resources” across China’s economy and society, it said in March 2023.

    例句讲解：这个词组是information（信息）和technology（技术）的组合，表示“信息技术”。在这个例句中，它特指有关信息处理和传输的技术，通常包括计算机、软件、数据通信和数据系统等。

  • national development and reform commission - 国家发展和改革委员会。

    原文例句：The agency, established under China’s top economic planner, the National Development and Reform Commission, is headed by information technology (IT) veteran Liu Liehong, former chairman of state-owned telecommunications network operator China Unicom.

    例句讲解：这个词组是national（国家），development（发展），reform（改革）和commission（委员会）的组合，是中华人民共和国的一个重要组成部分，负责研究和拟订国民经济和社会发展计划，并监督和检查其执行情况。

句子：

  • China’s newly established data administration, an agency created by Beijing to make data an effective production factor, has unveiled a three-year action plan to use the country’s massive troves of information to boost its economy. - 中国新成立的数据管理局——国家数据局，为使数据成为有效的生产要素而创建，该机构已公布一项三年行动计划，计划利用国家大量的信息来提振经济。

    句子分析：这是一个单句，主句是China’s newly established data administration has unveiled a three-year action plan，其中主语是China’s newly established data administration，谓语是has unveiled，宾语是a three-year action plan。an agency created by Beijing to make data an effective production factor是一个现在分词短语作定语，修饰China’s newly established data administration，表示国家数据局是由北京创建的，目的是使数据成为有效的生产要素。to use the country’s massive troves of information to boost its economy是一个不定式作目的语，说明国家数据局公布三年的行动计划的目标，即利用国家大量的信息来提振经济。这个句子的意思是说，中国新成立的数据管理局——国家数据局，为使数据成为有效的生产要素而创建，该机构已公布一项三年行动计划，计划利用国家大量的信息来提振经济。

语法：

  • 过去分词短语作定语 - 表示对先行词的限定或修饰。

    原文例句：According to the plan published by the National Data Administration (NDA) on Thursday, China aims to build more than 300 “representative” application scenarios by 2026.

    语法讲解：这个句子中，published by the National Data Administration (NDA)是一个过去分词短语，作定语，修饰plan，表示这个计划是由国家数据管理局（NDA）发布的。

  • 不定式作目的语 - 表示动作或状态的目的或意图。

    原文例句：The goal was to unleash economic value while ensuring security and privacy.

    语法讲解：这个句子中，to unleash economic value while ensuring security and privacy是一个不定式作目的语，表示释放经济价值的目的是为了确保安全和隐私。

  • China aims to build more than 300 ‘representative’ application scenarios by 2026, and grow its data industry by 20 per cent every year
  • The digital economy still faces challenges including low quality of data supply, a poor circulation mechanism and untapped applications potential

China’s newly established data administration, an agency created by Beijing to make data an effective production factor, has unveiled a three-year action plan to use the country’s massive troves of information to boost its economy.

According to the plan published by the National Data Administration (NDA) on Thursday, China aims to build more than 300 “representative” application scenarios by 2026, grow its data industry by 20 per cent every year, and multiply data trading volume.

The initiative is aimed at “cultivating” a new driving force for China’s economic development, leveraging the country’s advantages including a sizeable market, and abundant data resources and use cases, the NDA said.

The agency’s plan involves mobilising data resources to support development of China’s own artificial intelligence (AI) large language models - the technology used to train AI applications like ChatGPT. It will also increase efforts to have research institutions and leading enterprises build industry databases to create high quality datasets for training AI models.

China’s digital economy push for 12 sectors sets sights on finance, tech, farms

The blueprint comes at a time when China’s digital economy, having developed rapidly in recent years, still faces challenges including the low quality of data supply, a poor circulation mechanism and untapped potential for applications, it said.

The NDA was announced in March last year as Beijing ramped up efforts in managing the country’s growing pool of data that is fragmented across different sectors and industries. The goal was to unleash economic value while ensuring security and privacy.

While the country’s internet watchdog, the Cyberspace Administration of China, has put in place laws and regulations governing data security, Beijing did not have a government body overseeing development policies for data until the establishment of the NDA.

The new administration, which officially began operations in October, is tasked with “coordinating and promoting the construction of data infrastructure, coordinating the integration, sharing, development and utilisation of data resources” across China’s economy and society, it said in March 2023.

China’s focuses on digital economy to drive ‘common prosperity’ under Xi

The agency, established under China’s top economic planner, the National Development and Reform Commission, is headed by information technology (IT) veteran Liu Liehong, former chairman of state-owned telecommunications network operator China Unicom.

The three-year plan will “guide and encourage” different types of private capital to invest in the data industry, and support data brokers in raising capital by going public.

The NDA also singled out 12 industries that should make better use of data, including manufacturing, agriculture, commerce, transport, finance and IT.

China’s new data strategies come as it seeks to catch up with the US in the development of AI, despite facing a host of challenges including restricted access to advanced chips.

item.title: Hong Kong-listed Chinese miner CMOC takes Glencore’s cobalt crown as output jumps 170% in 2023
item.description:
English Summary：

China’s CMOC Group became the world’s leading producer of cobalt in 2023. The company's cobalt output surged by 170%, surpassing Glencore. CMOC produced 55,526 tonnes of cobalt, buoyed by its new Kisanfu mine in the Democratic Republic of Congo. The increased production contributed to a 30% drop in cobalt prices due to oversupply. CMOC's copper production also saw a significant 51% growth. Cobalt is a key material for EV batteries, and its demand is expected to grow with the increasing popularity of electric vehicles.
  • Abstract: China's CMOC Group becomes the world's largest cobalt producer, driving down prices.
  • Theme: CMOC's dominance in cobalt production, factors contributing to the price decline, and the growing demand for cobalt in the EV industry.
  • Viewpoint: The role of CMOC in the global cobalt market, the impact of production increase on prices, and the potential market demand for cobalt in the future.
  • Main information: CMOC's production increase by 170%, surpassing Glencore; Kisanfu mine's contribution to the surge; cobalt price drop due to oversupply; CMOC's copper production growth; cobalt's significance in EV batteries; increasing demand for EVs.

中文总结：

中国的五矿集团在2023年成为全球最大的钴生产商。该公司的钴产量激增了170%，超过了嘉能可。五矿集团生产了55,526吨钴，该公司在刚果民主共和国的新Kisanfu矿山产量激增。增产导致钴价因供应过剩而下降了30%。五矿集团的铜产量也大幅增长了51%。钴是电动汽车电池的关键材料，随着电动汽车的日益普及，对其需求有望增长。
  • 摘要：中国的五矿集团成为全球最大的钴生产商，从而压低了价格。
  • 主题：五矿集团在钴产量中的主导地位、导致价格下跌的因素以及电动汽车行业对钴日益增长的需求。
  • 观点：五矿集团在全球钴市场中的作用、产量增加对价格的影响以及未来钴的潜在市场需求。
  • 主要信息：五矿集团产量增长170%，超过嘉能可；Kisanfu矿山对激增的贡献；钴价因供应过剩而下降；五矿集团的铜产量增长；钴在电动汽车电池中的重要性；对电动汽车的需求不断增长。

单词：

  • surge (v.) - /sɜːrdʒ/ 激增，猛增。

    原文例句：CMOC’s copper output also jumped by 51 per cent to 419,539 tonnes, establishing it as one of the world’s top producers at a time when many miners are struggling to boost output.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于古英语surgen（上升，冲高），表示“涌出，喷发，激增”。在这个例句中，它指的是五矿集团的铜产量大幅增长了51%，达到419,539吨，使该集团成为世界领先的铜生产商之一，特别是在许多矿企都在努力提高产量的情况下。

  • slump (n.) - /slʌmp/ 暴跌，剧跌。

    原文例句：Soaring output at the US$1.8 billion Kisanfu mine helped trigger a sharp slump in cobalt prices last year, alongside rising production in Indonesia and a rebound in exports from CMOC’s other operation in Congo, Tenke-Fungurume.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于中世纪英语slumpen（坠落，滑落），表示“突然而大幅的下跌”。在这个例句中，它指的是在美国18亿美元的Kisanfu矿山产量激增的情况下，钴价格去年大幅下跌，而印度尼西亚的产量增加和CMOC在刚果的另一个矿山Tenke-Fungurume的出口反弹也导致了这一跌势。

词组：

  • in a bid to - 为了，以……为目的。

    原文例句：The mismatch between supply and demand became so acute that by midyear Glencore had started to stockpile surplus at its operations in Congo in a bid to bring the market back into balance.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由in（在……中），a（一个），bid（出价，投标）和to（向……）构成的，表示“为了，以……为目的”。在这个例句中，它表示，由于供需之间的差距变得如此严重，嘉能可在年中时开始在其刚果的业务中囤积剩余的钴，目的是为了让市场恢复平衡。

句子：

  • While investors and traders had been expecting a large increase at CMOC’s massive Kisanfu mine – which came online in the second quarter – the full-year result exceeded the company’s own production guidance by more than 20 per cent. - 虽然投资者和交易员们一直期待五矿集团规模庞大的Kisanfu矿山大幅增产——该矿山在第二季度投产——但全年产量超过了该公司自身生产目标的20%以上。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是The full-year result exceeded the company’s own production guidance by more than 20 per cent，其中主语是The full-year result，谓语是exceeded，宾语是the company’s own production guidance by more than 20 per cent。While investors and traders had been expecting a large increase at CMOC’s massive Kisanfu mine – which came online in the second quarter –是一个独立结构作状语，表示虽然投资者和交易员们一直期待五矿集团规模庞大的Kisanfu矿山大幅增产——该矿山在第二季度投产——。这个句子的意思是说，虽然投资者和交易员们一直期待五矿集团规模庞大的Kisanfu矿山大幅增产——该矿山在第二季度投产——但全年产量超过了该公司自身生产目标的20%以上。

语法：

  • 现在完成时 - 表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。

    原文例句：CMOC’s copper output also jumped by 51 per cent to 419,539 tonnes, establishing it as one of the world’s top producers at a time when many miners are struggling to boost output.

    语法讲解：这是一种时态，结构是：have/has + been + 过去分词。其中have/has要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，been是be的过去分词，过去分词是动词的-ed形式或不规则过去分词形式。这种时态表示动作或状态从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在，强调动作或状态的持续性和未完成性。在这个例句中，它表示五矿集团的铜产量也大幅增长了51%，达到419,539吨，使该集团成为世界领先的铜生产商之一，特别是在许多矿企都在努力提高产量的情况下。

  • The company’s output of the key metal in EV batteries exceeded its own guidance by more than 20 per cent
  • Soaring output at CMOC’s US$1.8 billion Kisanfu mine helped trigger a sharp slump in cobalt prices last year

China’s CMOC Group boosted its cobalt output by more than 170 per cent last year, with surging production at a new mine in the Democratic Republic of Congo helping the company leapfrog Glencore as the world’s top producer of the key battery metal.

Hong Kong-listed CMOC produced 55,526 tonnes of cobalt in 2023, it said in a filing on Thursday. In October, Glencore forecast output of as much as 42,000 tonnes. While investors and traders had been expecting a large increase at CMOC’s massive Kisanfu mine – which came online in the second quarter – the full-year result exceeded the company’s own production guidance by more than 20 per cent.

Soaring output at the US$1.8 billion Kisanfu mine helped trigger a sharp slump in cobalt prices last year, alongside rising production in Indonesia and a rebound in exports from CMOC’s other operation in Congo, Tenke-Fungurume. The market was already in one of its biggest ever surpluses as 2023 began, and the additional output helped drive a 30 per cent slump in prices over the year.

The mismatch between supply and demand became so acute that by midyear Glencore had started to stockpile surplus at its operations in Congo in a bid to bring the market back into balance. Glencore is set to announce its full production results next month.

CMOC’s copper output also jumped by 51 per cent to 419,539 tonnes, establishing it as one of the world’s top producers at a time when many miners are struggling to boost output.

Cobalt is a material used in NCM (lithium, nickel, cobalt and manganese) batteries powering electric cars, which offer vehicles a longer driving range than nickel-based LFP (lithium, iron and phosphate) counterparts.

Global consultancy AlixPartners forecast in a research report in July that electric vehicles (EVs) would account for 34 per cent of global sales by 2028 and make up 61 per cent of sales in 2035, compared to 14 per cent in 2022.

In China, the EV penetration rate exceeded 40 per cent in 2023 amid motorists’ rising penchant for environmentally friendly cars featuring autonomous driving technology and digital cockpits.

Mainland China is now the world’s largest automotive and EV market, with sales of battery-powered cars accounting for about 60 per cent of the global total.

Chinese EV battery maker Gotion starts making energy storage packs in US

Electric vehicle (EV) sales on the mainland, however, are seen growing 20 per cent year on year in 2024, according to a Fitch Ratings’ report in November, slowing from the projected 30 per cent increase in 2023.

Seoul-based consultancy SNE Research said in a report last February that electric cars with a driving range of more than 300 kilometres were sold at about US$30,000, on par with prices of petrol-powered vehicles, which helped EVs gain popularity around the globe.

Additional reporting by Daniel Ren

item.title: Qualcomm unveils chip for mixed reality to compete with Apple’s Vision Pro
item.description:
Summary：

  • Qualcomm, a leading chip designer, introduces the Snapdragon XR2+ chip aimed at virtual and mixed-reality headsets, targeting to compete with Apple's upcoming Vision Pro.
  • This new chip boasts the capability of operating 12 or more high-resolution cameras, enhancing the user's experience in augmented and virtual reality applications.
  • Samsung and Google are among the first companies to adopt the Snapdragon XR2+ chip for their upcoming mixed-reality products.

总结：

  • 高通，作为领先的芯片设计公司，发布了骁龙XR2+芯片，专注于虚拟和混合现实头戴设备，目标是与苹果即将推出的Vision Pro竞争。
  • 这款新的芯片功能强大，能够运行12个或更多高分辨率摄像头，增强用户在增强和虚拟现实应用中的体验。
  • 三星和谷歌是首批采用骁龙XR2+芯片用于其即将推出的混合现实产品的公司。

单词：

  • chip (n.) - /tʃɪp/ 芯片。

    原文例句：Qualcomm, the biggest maker of mobile phone processors, announced the Snapdragon XR2+ chip designed for virtual and mixed-reality headsets that will compete with Apple’s forthcoming Vision Pro.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Middle English，意思是“切掉的小块”。在这个例句中，它指的是Qualcomm设计的一种用于虚拟和混合现实设备的芯片，这种芯片被称为骁龙 XR2+。

  • headset (n.) - /ˈhɛdˌsɛt/ 头戴式设备。

    原文例句：The market for devices that project information onto the user’s view of the physical world was fired up last year by Apple’s announcement that it would sell a mixed-reality headset.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于head（头部）和set（设置），意思是“戴在头上的设备”。在这个例句中，它指的是一种可以让人们看到虚拟或增强现实内容的设备。

词组：

  • at the heart of - 在……的核心，是……的核心。

    原文例句：Qualcomm’s chips have been at the heart of many other companies’ attempts to lure consumers to the category, which has not yet taken off.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由at（在），the（定冠词）和heart（心脏）组成的，表示“在……的核心，是……的核心”。在这个例句中，它表示高通的芯片一直是许多其他公司试图吸引消费者进入这一类别的核心，这一类别尚未流行起来。

句子：

  • Headsets with the XR2+ will use processors and graphics components that are as much as 20 per cent better than their predecessors to project 4K-resolution images on each lens, according to Qualcomm’s Said Bakadir, a senior director of product management. - 根据高通产品管理高级总监赛义德·巴卡迪尔的说法，配备XR2+的头戴设备将使用比上一代产品性能提升多达20%的处理器和图形组件，从而在每个镜片上投影出4K分辨率的图像。

    句子分析：这是一个复杂句，主句是Headsets with the XR2+ will use，其中主语是Headsets with the XR2+，谓语是will use。processors and graphics components that are as much as 20 per cent better than their predecessors to project 4K-resolution images on each lens是一个非限制性定语从句，修饰Headsets with the XR2+，表示这些头戴设备将使用比上一代产品性能提升多达20%的处理器和图形组件，从而在每个镜片上投影出4K分辨率的图像。according to Qualcomm’s Said Bakadir, a senior director of product management是一个插入语，提供有关信息的来源，即根据高通产品管理高级总监赛义德·巴卡迪尔的说法。这个句子的意思是说，配备XR2+的头戴设备将使用比上一代产品性能提升多达20%的处理器和图形组件，从而在每个镜片上投影出4K分辨率的图像，根据高通产品管理高级总监赛义德·巴卡迪尔的说法。

语法：

  • 现在完成时 - 表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。

    原文例句：Qualcomm, the biggest maker of mobile phone processors, announced the Snapdragon XR2+ chip designed for virtual and mixed-reality headsets that will compete with Apple’s forthcoming Vision Pro.

    语法讲解：这是一种时态，结构是：have/has + 过去分词。其中have/has要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，过去分词是动词的-ed或不规则变化形式。这种时态表示动作或状态从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在，强调动作或状态的持续性和未完成性。在这个例句中，它表示高通已经发布了骁龙XR2+芯片，这种芯片专为虚拟和混合现实头戴设备而设计，并将与苹果即将推出的Vision Pro竞争。

  • The chip design firm said the new component, which can run 12 or more high-definition cameras, will be used by Samsung and Google
  • Qualcomm’s chips have been at the heart of many other companies’ attempts to lure consumers to the category, which has not yet taken off

Qualcomm, the biggest maker of mobile phone processors, announced the Snapdragon XR2+ chip designed for virtual and mixed-reality headsets that will compete with Apple’s forthcoming Vision Pro.

The San Diego, California-based chip design firm said the new component, which can run 12 or more high-definition cameras, will be used by Samsung Electronics and Alphabet’s Google on products under development.

The market for devices that project information onto the user’s view of the physical world was fired up last year by Apple’s announcement that it would sell a mixed-reality headset. Qualcomm’s chips have been at the heart of many other companies’ attempts to lure consumers to the category, which has not yet taken off.

Augmented reality imposes graphics and written content on top of a person’s view of the world. Virtual reality places a consumer in a closed digital world. Apple’s coming Vision Pro and Meta Platforms' most-recent Quest 3 headset mix the technologies. Previous versions of Qualcomm’s XR chip have been featured in devices from Microsoft and Meta.

Virtual reality could be key to easing fears in surgical patients: study

Headsets with the XR2+ will use processors and graphics components that are as much as 20 per cent better than their predecessors to project 4K-resolution images on each lens, according to Qualcomm’s Said Bakadir, a senior director of product management.

That improvement in quality will ease eye fatigue from reading text, reduce the potential for motion sickness and let device makers implement new features, he said. The chip’s ability to handle more cameras will aid in-depth perception and the eye tracking required to orient the user in the real world and recognise items.

“A lot of people want more juice to do more things,” Bakadir said. “People want to push the platform even higher.”

Qualcomm is working with a number of partners in addition to Google and Samsung, and announcements from customers may come as soon as next week’s CES show with products available as early as this year, he said.

item.title: OpenAI in talks with dozens of publishers to license content
item.description:
Summary：

OpenAI与政治新闻媒体Politico的母公司Axel Springer签署了一项价值数千万美元的多年许可协议。作为培训其人工智能模型的一种更广泛的努力，OpenAI目前正在与数十家出版商谈判达成许可其文章的协议。这些协议对于OpenAI的未来至关重要，因为它需要平衡构建模型所需的最新、准确的数据与人们对其数据来源的日益严格审查。
  • Abstract: OpenAI and Politico's parent company sign a multi-year licensing deal.
  • Theme: OpenAI's efforts to license articles from publishers for training its AI models.
  • Viewpoint: The importance of updated, accurate data for OpenAI's AI models; the legal and ethical challenges surrounding the use of copyrighted content for training AI models.
  • Main information: OpenAI's negotiations with dozens of publishers; the lawsuit filed by The New York Times against OpenAI and Microsoft; the potential impact of the lawsuit on OpenAI's business.

总结：

OpenAI 与政治新闻媒体 Politico 的母公司 Axel Springer 签署了一项价值数千万美元的多年许可协议。作为培训其人工智能模型的一种更广泛的努力，OpenAI 目前正在与数十家出版商谈判达成许可其文章的协议。这些协议对于 OpenAI 的未来至关重要，因为它需要平衡构建模型所需的最新、准确的数据与人们对其数据来源的日益严格审查。
  • 摘要：OpenAI 与 Politico 的母公司签署了一项多年许可协议。
  • 主题：OpenAI 为训练其人工智能模型而许可文章的努力。
  • 观点：最新、准确的数据对于 OpenAI 的人工智能模型的重要性；围绕使用受版权保护的内容训练人工智能模型的法律和伦理挑战。
  • 主要信息：OpenAI 与数十家出版商的谈判；纽约时报对 OpenAI 和微软提起的诉讼；该诉讼对 OpenAI 业务的潜在影响。

单词：

  • ink (v.) - /ɪŋk/ 签订合同，达成协议。

    原文例句：OpenAI recently inked a multi-year licensing deal with Politico’s parent company Axel Springer for tens of millions of dollars

    例句讲解：这个单词是由古英语单词“encan”演变而来的，意思是“使成为法律”。在这个例句中，它指的是OpenAI与Politico的母公司Axel Springer签订了一项价值数千万美元的多年许可协议。

  • disclose (v.) - /dɪˈskloʊz/ 披露，公开。

    原文例句：In July, OpenAI announced an agreement with the Associated Press for an undisclosed amount.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于拉丁语单词“discludere”，意思是“打开，分开”。在这个例句中，它涉及OpenAI与美联社达成了一项协议，但具体金额没有披露。

词组：

  • strike a deal - 达成协议，达成交易。

    原文例句：OpenAI is talking to dozens of publishers about striking deals to license their articles, a broader effort than was previously known, as the start-up looks for content to train its artificial intelligence (AI) models.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由strike（罢工，打击）和deal（交易，协议）组成的，表示“达成协议，达成交易，达成合同”。在这个例句中，它指的是OpenAI正在与数十家出版商谈判，以达成许可其文章的协议，这是OpenAI为训练其人工智能模型而做出的更广泛的努力之一。

句子：

  • “We are in the middle of many negotiations and discussions with many publishers. They are active. They are very positive. They’re progressing well,” Tom Rubin, OpenAI’s chief of intellectual property and content, told Bloomberg News. - “我们正在与许多出版商进行许多谈判和讨论。他们很积极。他们非常积极。他们的进展很顺利，”OpenAI 的知识产权和内容主管汤姆·鲁宾告诉彭博新闻社。

    句子分析：这是一个复杂句，主句是They are progressing well，其中主语是They，谓语是are progressing，宾语是well。we are in the middle of many negotiations and discussions with many publishers是一个现在进行时态的分词短语作状语，表示OpenAI目前正在进行许多谈判和讨论。They are active和They are very positive都是现在时态的分词短语作状语，表示出版商们很积极，他们非常积极。这个句子的意思是说，我们正在与许多出版商进行许多谈判和讨论，他们很积极，非常积极，他们的进展很顺利。

语法：

  • 现在进行时 - 表示正在进行或发生的动作或状态。

    原文例句：OpenAI is talking to dozens of publishers about striking deals to license their articles, ...

    语法讲解：这是一个时态，结构是：be + 动词的现在分词（-ing形式）。其中be根据主语的人称和数进行变化，动词的现在分词表示动作或状态正在进行。这种时态用来表示正在进行或发生的动作或状态，强调动作或状态的持续性。在这个例句中，它表示OpenAI正在与数十家出版商谈判，以达成许可其文章的协议。

  • 过去完成时 - 表示在过去某个时间点之前已经完成的动作或状态。

    原文例句：In July, OpenAI announced an agreement with the Associated Press for an undisclosed amount.

    语法讲解：这是一个时态，结构是：had + 过去分词。其中had根据主语的人称和数进行变化，过去分词是动词的过去式或过去分词形式。这种时态用来表示在过去某个时间点之前已经完成的动作或状态，强调动作或状态的完成性。在这个例句中，它表示OpenAI在7月份宣布了一项与美联社达成的协议，但具体金额没有披露。

  • OpenAI recently inked a multi-year licensing deal with Politico’s parent company Axel Springer for tens of millions of dollars
  • One of the companies it had been in talks with, The New York Times, sued OpenAI and Microsoft for using articles without permission

OpenAI said it is talking to dozens of publishers about striking deals to license their articles, a broader effort than was previously known, as the start-up looks for content to train its artificial intelligence (AI) models.

“We are in the middle of many negotiations and discussions with many publishers. They are active. They are very positive. They’re progressing well,” Tom Rubin, OpenAI’s chief of intellectual property and content, told Bloomberg News. “You’ve seen deals announced, and there will be more in the future.”

OpenAI recently inked a multi-year licensing deal with Politico’s parent company Axel Springer for tens of millions of dollars, a person familiar with the matter previously told Bloomberg. In July, OpenAI announced an agreement with the Associated Press for an undisclosed amount. These deals are key to OpenAI’s future, as it is balancing the need for updated, accurate data to build its models with growing scrutiny about where that data is sourced from.

Chinese AI champion SenseTime introduces Go playing robot to Japan, South Korea

But last week, one of the companies it had been in talks with, The New York Times Co, sued OpenAI and Microsoft for using the publication’s articles without permission.

The suit poses an existential challenge to OpenAI’s business. If the Times wins the case, OpenAI may not only owe billions of dollars, but could also be forced to destroy any of its training data that includes work from the Times, a costly and complicated task. More immediately, however, the lawsuit complicates OpenAI’s deal-making efforts with the media industry.

“The current situation is vastly different than the situations that publishers faced in the past with search engines and social media,” Rubin said. “Here, the content is used for training a model. It’s not used to reproduce the content. It’s not used to replace the content.”

China’s cloud market growth plateaus despite big AI push

The Times, however, disagrees with OpenAI’s stance, arguing that ChatGPT is flat out copying its journalists’ work without paying for it.

In its lawsuit, the publisher showed examples in which ChatGPT spit out entire paragraphs of nearly verbatim text from The New York Times (although some have pointed out that in certain examples, it was specifically prompting ChatGPT to reproduce Times content). The publisher argues that is proof OpenAI used New York Times data.

“If Microsoft and OpenAI want to use our work for commercial purposes, the law requires that they first obtain our permission,” The New York Times said in a statement. “They have not done so.”

item.title: Hong Kong-based AI-driven company sells potential breast cancer drug in deal whose value could exceed US$500 million
item.description:
English Summary：

Insilico Medicine, an AI-driven drug discovery company, has sold its preclinical drug candidate for breast cancer treatment to Italy-based pharmaceutical company Menarini Group in a deal worth over US$500 million. The agreement grants Stemline, a subsidiary of Menarini, exclusive global rights to develop and commercialize a novel small molecule KAT6A inhibitor as a potential treatment for hormone-sensitive cancers. AI technology is playing an increasingly important role in drug discovery, with the AI-driven drug discovery market projected to reach an estimated value of US$7.1 billion by 2030. Insilico's founder and co-CEO, Dr. Alex Zhavoronkov, emphasizes the technology's ability to accelerate the identification of potential drugs. Breast cancer, the most common cancer worldwide, is expected to see a significant market growth in the coming years. Insilico has a diversified pipeline of 31 programs targeting various diseases, and recently announced plans for an IPO in Hong Kong to fund clinical trials of its AI-discovered drugs. The company has raised over $400 million in private markets.
  • Abstract: Insilico sells its breast cancer drug candidate to Menarini Group, unlocking a potential treatment for hormone-sensitive cancers.
  • Theme: AI technology drives drug discovery, leading to a multi-million dollar deal between Insilico and Menarini for a novel breast cancer treatment.
  • Viewpoint: The promise of AI in revolutionizing drug discovery and the potential impact of this partnership on the development of cancer therapies.
  • Main information: Details of the agreement, including upfront payment, sales royalties, and development milestones; market size and growth projections for AI-driven drug discovery; Insilico's pipeline and plans for an IPO.

中文总结：

Insilico Medicine，一家人工智能驱动的药物研发公司，以超过 5 亿美元的交易价格，将其用于治疗乳腺癌的临床前候选药物出售给了位于意大利的制药公司 Menarini 集团。该协议授予 Menarini 的子公司 Stemline 独家全球权利，以开发和商业化新型小分子 KAT6A 抑制剂，作为治疗激素敏感性癌症的潜在疗法。人工智能技术在药物研发中发挥着日益重要的作用，预计到 2030 年，人工智能驱动的药物研发市场将达到 71 亿美元的估值。Insilico 的创始人兼联合首席执行官 Alex Zhavoronkov 博士强调了该技术加速识别潜在药物的能力。乳腺癌是全球最常见的癌症，预计未来几年将迎来显着的市场增长。Insilico 拥有针对多种疾病的 31 个多元化项目，并最近宣布了在香港进行首次公开募股的计划，以资助其人工智能发现的药物的临床试验。该公司已在私人市场筹集了超过 4 亿美元。
  • 摘要：Insilico 将其乳腺癌候选药物出售给 Menarini 集团，解锁了对激素敏感性癌症的潜在治疗方法。
  • 主题：人工智能技术推动药物发现，促成 Insilico 与 Menarini 之间针对新型乳腺癌治疗药物的数百万美元交易。
  • 观点：人工智能在药物发现领域变革的承诺，以及这种伙伴关系对癌症治疗方法开发的潜在影响。
  • 主要信息：协议细节，包括预付款、销售提成和开发里程碑；人工智能驱动的药物发现的市场规模和增长预测；Insilico 的项目和首次公开募股计划。

单词：

  • catalyst (n.) - /ˈkætəlɪst/ 催化剂。

    原文例句：AI has emerged as a catalyst in revolutionising drug discovery by enhancing efficiency and accuracy while reducing the time-consuming aspects of research and development, experts say.

    例句讲解：Catalyst 意思为“催化剂”，常用于化学领域，指能改变化学反应速度但不参与反应的物质。在引文中，Catalyst 比喻人工智能技术在药品发现中的促进作用。

  • clinical trial (n.) - /ˈklɪnɪkəl traɪəl/ 临床试验。

    原文例句：In June last year, the company revealed an IPO plan in Hong Kong after shelving a New York fundraising plan, to fund clinical trials of drugs discovered and designed by artificial intelligence.

    例句讲解：Clinical trial 指的是对药物或医疗器械在人体中的安全性、疗效等进行评估的研究。在这个句子中，Clinical trial 指的是对由人工智能发现和设计的药物进行的临床试验。

词组：

  • play a role in - 起作用，发挥作用。

    原文例句：AI has emerged as a catalyst in revolutionising drug discovery by enhancing efficiency and accuracy while reducing the time-consuming aspects of research and development, experts say.

    例句讲解：“play a role in”的意思是“发挥作用，起作用”。在这个句子中，它表示人工智能技术在药品发现中发挥着关键的作用。

  • make a payment - 付款。

    原文例句：Stemline Therapeutics, a wholly owned unit of Menarini, will make a US$12 million upfront payment to Insilico under the agreement, which will be followed by sales royalties worth up to “double digits”.

    例句讲解：“make a payment”的意思是“付款”。在这个句子中，它表示Menarini的全资子公司Stemline Therapeutics将向Insilico支付1200万美元的预付款。

句子：

  • AI has emerged as a catalyst in revolutionising drug discovery by enhancing efficiency and accuracy while reducing the time-consuming aspects of research and development, experts say. - 专家表示，人工智能已成为革新药物发现的催化剂，它提高了效率和准确性，同时减少了耗时的研发环节。

    句子分析：这是一个复杂长句，主句是AI has emerged as a catalyst in revolutionising drug discovery，其中主语是AI，谓语是has emerged，宾语是a catalyst in revolutionising drug discovery。by enhancing efficiency and accuracy while reducing the time-consuming aspects of research and development是一个分词短语作状语，修饰主句，表示人工智能技术通过提高效率和准确性，同时减少耗时的研发环节，成为革新药物发现的催化剂。这个句子的意思是说，专家表示，人工智能已成为革新药物发现的催化剂，它提高了效率和准确性，同时减少了耗时的研发环节。

语法：

  • 过去完成时 - 表示在过去某个时间或动作发生之前已经完成的动作或状态。

    原文例句：In June last year, the company revealed an IPO plan in Hong Kong after shelving a New York fundraising plan, to fund clinical trials of drugs discovered and designed by artificial intelligence.

    语法讲解：过去完成时是由had/has + 过去分词构成的，表示在过去某个时间或动作发生之前已经完成的动作或状态。在这个句子中，revealed和shelving都是过去分词，表示这两个动作发生在fund之前已经完成。

  • 现在完成进行时 - 表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。

    原文例句：Insilico has raised more than US$400 million via private markets.

    语法讲解：现在完成进行时是由have/has been + 现在分词构成的，表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。在这个句子中，raised和been raising都是现在分词，表示Insilico从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态是筹集资金。

  • 被动语态 - 表示动作或状态是由句子中的宾语承受的。

    原文例句：Menarini, an international pharmaceutical and diagnostics company with a turnover of more than US$4.4 billion and operations in 140 countries, sees the collaboration with Insilico as an opportunity to explore new treatment approaches and potentially unlock transformative cancer therapies, according to CEO Elcin Barker Ergun.

    语法讲解：被动语态是由be + 过去分词构成的，表示动作或状态是由句子中的宾语承受的。在这个句子中，sees和explore都是被动语态，表示动作或状态是由句子中的宾语Menarini承受的。

  • Insilico grants Italy’s Menarini Group, the global rights to develop and commercialise a novel small molecule inhibitor, as a potential treatment for hormone-sensitive cancers
  • Breast cancer, a hormone-sensitive cancer, is the most common cancer worldwide, and the leading cause of cancer death among women, according to the WHO

Insilico Medicine, a Hong Kong-based AI-driven drug discovery company that intends to list in Hong Kong after it unveiled an initial public offering plan (IPO) last year, has sold its preclinical drug candidate for breast cancer treatment to Italy-based pharmaceutical company Menarini Group in a deal that could reach a value of over US$500 million.

Stemline Therapeutics, a wholly owned unit of Menarini, will make a US$12 million upfront payment to Insilico under the agreement, which will be followed by sales royalties worth up to “double digits”. The combined value of the deal includes all development, regulatory, and commercial milestones.

The agreement comes at a time when cutting-edge technology is playing a greater role in drug discovery. AI has emerged as a catalyst in revolutionising drug discovery by enhancing efficiency and accuracy while reducing the time-consuming aspects of research and development, experts say.

The AI-driven drug discovery market is projected to grow at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 23.72 per cent from 2023 to 2030, reaching an estimated value of US$7.1 billion by 2030, according to US-based Vantage Market Research.

The technology expedites the process of identifying potential drugs, according to Insilico’s founder and co-CEO, Dr Alex Zhavoronkov.

Under the exclusive licensing agreement, Insilico has granted Stemline the global rights to develop and commercialise a novel small molecule KAT6A inhibitor as a potential treatment for hormone-sensitive cancers and other oncology indications.

Sanofi signs with Hong Kong biotech firm Insilico to spur AI drug discovery

Breast cancer is the most common cancer worldwide and the leading cause of cancer death among women, according to the World Health Organization.

The global breast cancer market is projected to hit around US$73.68 billion by 2032 with a registered CAGR of 9.9 per cent, according to Precedence Research.

“The partnership at the early stage preclinical trial is truly optimal when the partner is very committed,” said Zhavoronkov.

Menarini, an international pharmaceutical and diagnostics company with a turnover of more than US$4.4 billion and operations in 140 countries, sees the collaboration with Insilico as an opportunity to explore new treatment approaches and potentially unlock transformative cancer therapies, according to CEO Elcin Barker Ergun.

Insilico, founded by Zhavoronkov in 2014, has a pipeline that consists of 31 programmes for 29 drug targets in cancer, fibrosis, immunity, central nervous system and ageing-related diseases.

In June last year, the company revealed an IPO plan in Hong Kong after shelving a New York fundraising plan, to fund clinical trials of drugs discovered and designed by artificial intelligence.

Zhavoronkov declined to reveal a timeline for its IPO but said market sentiment was a concern.

Insilico has a presence in the markets of the US, Greater China, Canada and the Middle East. It launched the Generative AI and Quantum Computing Research and Development Center in Abu Dhabi in February 2023.

To date, the company has raised more than US$400 million via private markets. In 2022, it secured series D financing of US$95 million from investors such as Prosperity7, a growth venture fund of Saudi Arabia’s Aramco, and others including B Capital Group, Warburg Pincus, and Hong Kong-based Qiming Ventures.

item.title: Chinese EV maker Hozon predicts fivefold jump in overseas sales as growth slows in hyper-competitive domestic market
item.description:
Summary：

  • Chinese electric vehicle (EV) startup Hozon New Energy Automobile aims to increase its overseas sales five-fold in 2024, targeting 100,000 unit deliveries in 60 markets.
  • The company has started assembling vehicles at its first overseas factory in Thailand and plans to open a second assembly facility outside China in the second quarter.
  • Hozon's overseas expansion is driven by slowing growth in the domestic EV market and intense competition among 200 players.

总结：

  • 中国电动汽车 (EV) 初创公司合众新能源汽车计划在 2024 年将其海外销量提高五倍，目标在 60 个市场交付 100,000 辆汽车。
  • 该公司已开始在泰国的第一家海外工厂组装汽车，并计划在第二季度在中国境外开设第二家组装工厂。
  • 合众新能源汽车的海外扩张是由国内电动汽车市场增长放缓和 200 家参与者的激烈竞争推动的。

    原文例句：Beijing-based Nio is also a top-tier electric car maker that many car buyers count on.

    例句讲解：这个短语由count（计算，计算）和on（在……上）构成，表示“依赖；指望”。在这个例句中，它指的是许多汽车买家依赖蔚来这个顶级电动汽车制造商。

  • Middle East - 中东

    原文例句：Zhou said the carmaker targets total sales of 1 million EVs in 2026, including 400,000 outside mainland China. It also plans to build plants in markets like the Middle East, Africa and South America, he said.

    例句讲解：这个词组表示亚洲西南部、地中海东部和非洲东北部地区，包括巴林、埃及、伊朗、伊拉克、以色列、约旦、科威特、黎巴嫩、阿曼、卡塔尔、沙特阿拉伯、叙利亚、土耳其、阿拉伯联合酋长国和也门等国。
